title: Is there any free software to open and edit .so files? [closed]
content: I am not thinking of a specific platform, anyway I likes to read and edit .so files

comments.text: Do you mean dynamic libraries on *nix platforms and what do you mean by edit?
Have you considered libbfd/binutils? It ought to have most of the functionality anyone could want for manipulating .so files. It would be helpful if you would clarify your question a little.

answers_data.content:
You have multiple choice:

So, if you are looking for something free, objdump or ODA are your best bets.

Remember that the platform matter! For example if you are trying to diassemble a .so file from an ARM Android system with objdump, you need to install objdump from the ARM gcc toolchain.

comments.text: objdump is part of binutils, not part of the GCC toolchain. The GCC toolchain merely depends on binutils. Usual distros offer binutils for other architectures.
Thank you very much @C0000022L for pointing this out, I've edited my answer accordingly.

answers_data.content:
From http://file.org/extension/so

Winrar and Media Player are supposed to be able to open them.  You can also try a universal file opener: 
http://file.org/free-download/free-file-viewer
